Resources.name: Schema
Resources.description: Specifies the schema that describes a SCIM Schema

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The unique URI of the schema. When applicable service providers MUST specify the URI specified in the core schema specification

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The schema's human readable name. When applicable service providers MUST specify the name specified in the core schema specification; e.g., User

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The schema's human readable name. When applicable service providers MUST specify the name specified in the core schema specification; e.g., User

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description: A complex attribute that includes the attributes of a schema

subAttributes.name: name
subAttributes.description: The attribute's name

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: The attribute's data type. Valid values include: 'string', 'complex', 'boolean', 'decimal', 'integer', 'dateTime', 'reference'.

subAttributes.name: multiValued
subAttributes.description: Boolean indicating an attribute's plurality.

subAttributes.name: description
subAttributes.description: A human readable description of the attribute.

subAttributes.name: required
subAttributes.description: A boolean indicating if the attribute is required.

subAttributes.name: canonicalValues
subAttributes.description: A collection of canonical values.  When applicable service providers MUST specify the canonical types specified in the core schema specification; e.g., 'work', 'home'.

subAttributes.name: caseExact
subAttributes.description: Indicates if a string attribute is case-sensitive.

subAttributes.name: mutability
subAttributes.description: Indicates if an attribute is modifiable.

subAttributes.name: returned
subAttributes.description: Indicates when an attribute is returned in a response (e.g., to a query).

subAttributes.name: uniqueness
subAttributes.description: Indicates how unique a value must be.

subAttributes.name: referenceTypes
subAttributes.description: Used only with an attribute of type 'reference'. Specifies a SCIM resourceType that a reference attribute MAY refer to. e.g., User

subAttributes.name: subAttributes
subAttributes.description: Used to define the sub-attributes of a complex attribute

subAttributes.name: name
subAttributes.description: The attribute's name

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: The attribute's data type. Valid values include: 'string', 'complex', 'boolean', 'decimal', 'integer', 'dateTime', 'reference'.

subAttributes.name: returned

subAttributes.description: Indicates how unique a value must be.

Resources.name: ResourceType
Resources.description: Specifies the schema that describes a SCIM Resource Type

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The resource type's server unique id. May be the same as the 'name' attribute.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The resource type name. When applicable service providers MUST specify the name specified in the core schema specification; e.g., User

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The resource type's human readable description. When applicable service providers MUST specify the description specified in the core schema specification.

attributes.name: endpoint
attributes.description: The resource type's HTTP addressable endpoint relative to the Base URL; e.g., /Users

attributes.name: schema
attributes.description: The resource types primary/base schema URI

attributes.name: schemaExtensions
attributes.description: A list of URIs of the resource type's schema extensions

subAttributes.name: schema
subAttributes.description: The URI of a schema extension.

subAttributes.name: required
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether the schema extension is required for the resource type. If true, a resource of this type MUST include this schema extension and include any attributes declared as required in this schema extension. If false, a resource of this type MAY omit this schema extension.

attributes.name: manager
attributes.description: The User's manager. A complex type that optionally allows Service Providers to represent organizational hierarchy by referencing the 'id' attribute of another User.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: The id of the SCIM resource representing the User's  manager.

subAttributes.name: $ref
subAttributes.description: The URI of the SCIM resource representing the User's manager.

subAttributes.name: displayName
subAttributes.description: The displayName of the User's manager. OPTIONAL and READ-ONLY.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the User typically used by the user to directly authenticate to the service provider. Each User MUST include a non-empty id value.  This identifier MUST be unique across the Service Consumer's entire set of Users.

attributes.name: externalId
attributes.description: An identifier for the resource as defined by the provisioning client.  OPTIONAL

attributes.name: userName
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the User typically used by the user to directly authenticate to the service provider. Each User MUST include a non-empty userName value.  This identifier MUST be unique across the Service Consumer's entire set of Users.  REQUIRED

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The components of the user's real name. Providers MAY return just the full name as a single string in the formatted sub-attribute, or they MAY return just the individual component attributes using the other sub-attributes, or they MAY return both. If both variants are returned, they SHOULD be describing the same name, with the formatted name indicating how the component attributes should be combined.

subAttributes.name: formatted
subAttributes.description: The full name, including all middle names, titles, and suffixes as appropriate, formatted for display (e.g., Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III.).

subAttributes.name: familyName
subAttributes.description: The family name of the User, or Last Name in most Western languages (e.g. Jensen given the full name Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III.).

subAttributes.name: givenName
subAttributes.description: The given name of the User, or First Name in most Western languages (e.g. Barbara given the full name Ms. Barbara J Jensen, III.).

attributes.name: displayName
attributes.description: The name of the User, suitable for display to end-users. The name SHOULD be the full name of the User being described if known

attributes.name: userType
attributes.description: The type of the User, identify the relationship between the organization and the user.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: A Boolean value indicating the User's administrative status.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: The User's clear text password.  This attribute is intended to be used as a means to specify an initial password when creating a new User or to reset an existing User's password.

attributes.name: emails
attributes.description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g., bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

subAttributes.name: value
subAttributes.description: E-mail addresses for the user. The value SHOULD be canonicalized by the Service Provider, e.g. bjensen@example.com instead of bjensen@EXAMPLE.COM. Canonical Type values of work, home, and other.

subAttributes.name: type
subAttributes.description: A label indicating the attribute's function; e.g., 'work' or 'home'.

subAttributes.name: primary
subAttributes.description: A Boolean value indicating the 'primary' or preferred attribute value for this attribute, e.g., the preferred mailing address or primary e-mail address. The primary attribute value 'true' MUST appear no more than once.
